intro: Hypoxis declinata, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped white flowers that open at night. The plant has strap-like, grassy leaves and produces small, round berries that are edible. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Hypoxis declinata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
